description:
The third season of High School DxD.

The Red Dragon Emperor, Issei Hyoudou, and the Occult Research Club are back in action as summer break comes for the students of Kuoh Academy. After their fight with Issei’s sworn enemy, Vali and the Chaos Brigade, it is clear just how inexperienced Rias Gremory's team is. As a result, she and Azazel lead the club on an intense training regime in the Underworld to prepare them for the challenges that lie ahead.

While they slowly mature as a team, Issei will once again find himself in intimate situations with the girls of the Occult Research Club. Meanwhile, their adversaries grow stronger and more numerous as they rally their forces. And with the sudden appearance of Loki, the Evil God of Norse Mythology, the stage is set for epic fights and wickedly powerful devils in High School DxD BorN!

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

node.description:
__[Blog](http://ishibumi.exblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ishibumi_ddd)__

Ishibumi won the Fantasia Grand Price in 2005 with his first book Denpachi, which was later published in 2006, the same year as his second work SLASH/DOG was published. in 2008 he wrote the work that he is most known for, High School DxD. He currently works on several projects at once, and mostly writes for Fantasia Bunko. Ishibumi likes to build Gunpla and play Pokemon in his free time, which he often mentions in his blog. In 2018, Ichiei collapsed from overwork and has fought with several health conditions ever since, which is why he started writing slower in recent years.

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gotoujio)__

Junji Gotou is a Japanese animator and character designer, who mainly does animation direction and key animation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gotoujio)__

Junji Gotou is a Japanese animator and character designer, who mainly does animation direction and key animation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rsknkns)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rsknkns/)__

Ryousuke Nakanishi is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and musician, while also known as the representative director of Altus Inc. and managing director Up Dream Inc. He is also a member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Official site](http://stylips.jp/)

StylipS is a Japanese pop seiyuu girl group and sub-unit of HAPPY! STYLE under Up Front, which releases through Lantis. It features the same members from the promotional unit Team DEKARIS. StylipS was formed in 2011 to sing the ending theme song for the 2012 anime series [High School DxD](https://anilist.co/anime/11617), where each member would also lend their voice to a character. The group's debut event took place on December 28, 2011.

On April 20, 2013, the staff announced that Yui Ogura and Kaori Ishihara are leaving for their concern about workload impact on their studies in school, and they announced the two new members, Moe Toyota and Miku Itou, on April 27, 2013.

On May 23, 2016, the staff announced the graduation of Maho Matsunaga, who had been absent from performing throughout the previous year due to poor health. The 3-person group has only made several appearances afterwards.

__Members:__
• [Arisa Noto](https://anilist.co/staff/104775) (能登有沙) (Founding member)
• [Moe Toyota](https://anilist.co/staff/118398) (豊田萌絵) (Joined April, 2013)
• [Miku Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/118581) (伊藤美来) (Joined April, 2013)

__Former members:__
• [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217) (石原夏織) (Founding member — Graduated in April, 2013)
• [Yui Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105981) (小倉唯) (Founding member — Graduated in April, 2013)
• [Maho Matsunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/106789) (松永真穂) (Founding member — Graduated May, 2016)

[Website](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/masakierica/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masakierica)

Erika Masaki is a Japanese singer and lyricist affiliated with the Lantis label.

__[Official Website](http://choucho-net.com/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/choucho621/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choucho_)__ | __[NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/3416529) | [Instragram](https://www.instagram.com/choucho621/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGK8Fhw3qDEtHaivTsxfGgg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5t7eQ2d1UmzfIr9oWQ538Y?autoplay=true)__

__Introduction:__
ChouCho is a Japanese singer-utaite known for doing vocal covers of Vocaloid songs on NicoNico Douga, in addition to making frequent appearances in anime with original songs.

__Biography:__
In 2007, she initially formed the band Lotus*Lotus (stylized as ロータス★ロータス) while still in high school, the band performed covers of songs from anime, then starting from June 2008 she first appeared on NicoNico with her cover of the song "[Black★Rock Shooter](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3706654)" under stage name ちょうちょ. In 2011, she made her first major debut under record label Lantis, singing the opening theme song to the anime [Kamisama no Memochou](https://anilist.co/anime/10568/Kamisama-no-Memochou/), titled "[Kawaru Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Un9UiVL6Dms)", and later in the same year she reappeared with the opening theme song to the anime [Mashiroiro Symphony](https://anilist.co/anime/10397/Mashiroiro-Symphony-The-Color-of-Lovers), titled "[Authentic Symphony](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzGWaS0lyIo)", then in 2012, after releasing her 4th single titled "[Yasashisa no Riyuu](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hJiMN4Csjw)", she changed her stage name from ちょうちょ to ChouCho. The song was also used as the 1st opening theme song to the anime [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/Hyouka/), which released in 2012.

Her last upload to NicoNico was an album released with Comiket 81, titled "[Little Nostalgia](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm16484379)", featuring 5 songs: Breeze, Beautiful World (Acoustic Ver.), Hana to Hoshi no Monogatari, North York and Under the Maple Tree.

__[Archived Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/426)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://tatsuyatube.blog35.fc2.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakurauchi)__

__Tatsuya Kurauchi__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He previously worked for Smile Company.

__[Archived Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/426)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://tatsuyatube.blog35.fc2.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakurauchi)__

__Tatsuya Kurauchi__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He previously worked for Smile Company.

[Profile](https://vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=7) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaji__official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuki_kaji_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx2XAGS0FoG9S6r0bhNo2UA)

Kaji has won several awards, including Best Voice Actor at the 12th Tokyo Anime Awards (2013), Best Actor at the 7th Seiyu Awards (2013), and Best Voice Actor at the 36th Anime Grand Prix (2014).

Married voice actress [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) in 2019.
